H0.text: Proteins are broken down into amino acids by pepsin.

H1.text: Glucose is what pepsin helps break down into amino acids.

H2.text: Carbohydrates are the substances that pepsin helps break down into amino acids.

H3.text: Fats are substances that pepsin helps break down into amino acids.

A4.text: Pepsin is an endopeptidase that breaks down proteins into smaller peptides and amino acids.

A5.text: There are also exopeptidases which remove individual amino acids at both ends of proteins (carboxypeptidases produced by the pancreas and aminopeptidases secreted by the small intestine).
